Key Match Events: Bradley Barcola scored for France after just 13 seconds, marking his first international goal.
Federico Dimarco equalized for Italy with a fierce volley into the far top corner.
Davide Frattesi put Italy ahead with a goal five minutes into the second half.
Giacomo Raspadori extended Italy's lead with a goal in the 74th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps' team struggled to threaten after Italy's equalizer.
France had 12 shots compared to Italy’s 11 but only managed an expected goals total (xG) of 0.86.
Italy outperformed their own xG of 1.71.
Deschamps faces a tough test against Belgium next.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mateo Retegui was named Player of the Match for his constant threat and assist for Frattesi’s goal.
Bradley Barcola has scored five goals in his first four games at the start of the 2024/25 season.
